image.altText: A man frowning

props.synopsis: The Liberal federal executive launched a takeover of the party's New South Wales division after 140 candidates for the upcoming local government elections failed to be nominated.

title.children: Federal Liberals' plan to take over NSW division hits hurdle after former MP refuses administration role

image.altText: A road can be see through the windscreen of a military vehicle

props.synopsis: For the first time in more than five years and since the Ukraine war began, the ABC crosses into Russia to see what life is like in the occupied city of Sudzha.

title.children: After Ukraine's incursion into Russia, we cross the border and glimpse life behind Vladimir Putin's iron curtain

image.altText: A swimming pool surrounded by plants in a city area, with tall buildings in the background.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's leading hospitality groups, Merivale, has been accused of fostering a culture that places women at risk, condones drug use by staff and patrons and fails to adequately address claims of sexual assault.

title.children: Hospitality group Merivale accused of fostering culture that places women at risk

image.altText: George Alex at the trade union royal commission

props.synopsis: George Alex is one of five people to be found guilty of attempting to defraud the Commonwealth of more than $10 million.

title.children: Sydney construction boss found guilty of $10m ATO fraud after marathon trial

image.altText: Mad on left holds cupcakes while sitting next to another man and woman

props.synopsis: The post on the embassy's official Instagram account celebrated "Wear it Purple Day" and expressed dedication to creating "a supporting environment where everyone, especially LGBTQIA+ youth, can feel proud to be themselves".

title.children: Iran summons Australia's ambassador in Tehran over pro-LGBT Instagram post

image.altText: Two older people stand giving a press conference.

props.synopsis: A water police vessel returned a man and woman rescued from a stricken yacht on the south coast back to Sydney.

title.children: Sailors return safe to land after yacht rescue mission hailed 'resounding success'

image.altText: Protesters walk along a street holding a massive sign that says 'CFMEU. Here to stay'.

props.synopsis: The former national president of the CFMEU launches a legal challenge to laws that force the construction union to accept an administrator, after allegations of criminal consorting, corruption and thuggery.

title.children: Former CFMEU heads launch high court challenge over forced administration

image.altText: The Star, formally known as Star City Casino, Sydney.

props.synopsis: Cash isn't the only thing in short supply at Star Entertainment. Time is also running out for newly installed chief executive Steve McCann to get a deal across the line.

title.children: Time is running out for Star Entertainment to secure a rescue package

image.altText: Tim Bowden image

props.synopsis: Bowden discovered journalism as a teenager, sneaking into the back row of the theatre in 1950s Hobart to watch Cinesound newsreels, long before television was invented.

title.children: Former ABC broadcaster and author Tim Bowden dies, aged 87

image.altText: Portrait of a young man against a blurry neutral background

props.synopsis: It is a form of emergency care where young people are placed in temporary short-term accommodation when nothing else is available. But since a report highlighted cases of abuse and harm, the NSW government has confirmed a planned ban.

title.children: 'I'm very happy it's gone': Emergency care arrangements to be banned in NSW

image.altText: Madison de Rozario competing at Paris Paralympic Games.

props.synopsis: Brenden Hall and Madison de Rozario both have chances to add to their Paralympics medal hauls in the pool and on the track on day six in Paris. Follow the action in our live blog.

title.children: Madison de Rozario eyes another Paralympic medal on day six

image.altText: Two men walk past a military guard

props.synopsis: Living in Russia's shadow, Mongolia is not in a position to put President Vladimir Putin offside. But when he came to visit, the nation's obligations to the International Criminal Court were put into stark relief.

title.children: Vladimir Putin defied a war crimes arrest order to visit Mongolia. Here's what he might be up to

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenksyy speaks in front of a Ukrainian flag.

props.synopsis: The number of people killed has continued to rise since two ballistic missiles landed in the Ukrainian city of Poltava on Tuesday local time.

title.children: Russian missile strike on Ukrainian city kills at least 51 people, injures more than 200 others

image.altText: Woman with fair hair and man with grey hair stand together in formal clothes.

props.synopsis: Senator Linda Reynolds's lawyer tries to eviscerate Brittany Higgins's defamation defence by painting her as a deliberate liar who tried to ruin her former boss's career and bring down the Morrison government.

title.children: Linda Reynolds's lawyer attacks 'arrogant' Brittany Higgins for trivialising senator's hurt from the 'sanctity of France'

image.altText: Woman with tiger.

props.synopsis: An animal rescue organisation wants interactions between tigers and their handlers limited, as investigations continue into the mauling of an experienced worker at the Queensland theme park.

title.children: Dreamworld tiger attack prompts call for law change to protect animals and handlers

image.altText: Jaryd Clifford sinks to his knees and holds his head in his hands on the track

props.synopsis: While Jaryd Clifford was left heartbroken again, James Turner took his turn to celebrate a performance for the ages on the track on day six at the Paris Paralympics.

title.children: 'Almost so ridiculous it's funny': As Clifford curses his luck, Turner conquers the world

image.altText: Latrell Mitchell in action for the Rabbitohs

props.synopsis: The NRL has ruled Latrell Mitchell will serve a one-match ban for bringing the game into disrepute and his Rabbitohs teammates are hopeful he can get the suspension out of the way before the end of the season despite a foot injury.

title.children: Latrell Mitchell has been suspended for a match. But when will he serve his ban?

image.altText: A young man in a tropical shirt with

props.synopsis: Six months after he was kidnapped into Gaza with a grisly injury, 23-year-old Hersh Goldberg-Polin stunned everyone by appearing alive in a hostage video. His sudden death at the weekend has galvanised a nation.

title.children: Hersh was a symbol of hope for Israelis. His death has turned him into a symbol of rage against Netanyahu

image.altText: A photo of a handgun

props.synopsis: Police are investigating the alleged theft of dozens of historical handguns from a weapons museum in the NSW Central West. Despite their age, the weapons could be made operational.

title.children: Police fear stolen museum guns could be made operational

image.altText: A row of coal loaders.

props.synopsis: A 22-year-old woman charged over her involvement in blocking coal trains in the Hunter Valley is "relieved" after successfully appealing against her jail sentence.

title.children: Tasmanian protester wins appeal against three-month jail sentence for blocking Newcastle coal trains

image.altText: A person wearing a keffiyeh holds their fingers up in a peace sign, a Palestinian flag is in the background.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of Palestinian people apply for permanent protection as their tourist visas expire. Meanwhile the Coalition heaps pressure on the government after remarks made by ASIO boss Mike Burgess.

title.children: With expiring tourist visas, Palestinian people are applying for permanent protection in Australia

image.altText: A logo on a vehicle reads "Queensland police".

props.synopsis: Police are investigating the sudden death of a one-year-old boy at a daycare centre in Brisbane's east.

title.children: Police investigate sudden death of 1yo boy at daycare centre in Brisbane's east

image.altText: A graphic illustration shows a woman lying in bed staring at her phone in the dark

props.synopsis: We all know the pain of a blaring alarm clock after a late night, but sleep deprivation does more than just bring our mood down. This is what happens when you consistently short change yourself of a good night's rest.

title.children: Are you in the 25 per cent of people not getting enough sleep? Here's what it's doing to your body and brain

image.altText: The shadow of a young woman can be seen in front of the triple j sign

props.synopsis: Forced marriage is the most common form of human trafficking in Australia. We speak to a victim-survivor about how she escaped.

title.children: Aisha was engaged by the time she was 13. Within three years she'd taken her parents to court to escape a forced marriage

image.altText: A young boy wearing a blue hat uses a wooden paddle to scoop up glue to add to a small clay jar

props.synopsis: The child's father says he thought "please let that not be my child" after hearing a crash while touring artefacts in the Hecht Museum with his family.

title.children: Museum welcomes back boy who broke 3,500-year-old Bronze Age jar

image.altText: A tennis player wearing a cap, T-shirt and short, reaches out with his racquet to hit a ball.

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur sees off fellow Australian Jordan Thompson to book a place in the US Open quarterfinals.

title.children: De Minaur through to US Open quarterfinals after defeating fellow Australian Thompson

image.altText: A smirking man wearing a brown shirt takes a selfie shot.

props.synopsis: A seven-year-old who was allegedly smothered, choked and sexually assaulted by a man who broke into her home in the Perth suburb of Ellenbrook, told police she was not sure if it was a "nightmare or real".

title.children: Little girl allegedly sexually assaulted in bedroom told police she wasn't sure if it was a nightmare

image.altText: An aerial view of a woman wearing a wide-brimmed hat, sitting on the side of a swimming pool while working on her laptop.

props.synopsis: 'Quiet vacationing' is the trend of working from somewhere other than home, without telling your boss. But is it a good idea?

title.children: Taking holidays without telling your boss is trending. But is it a good idea?

image.altText: Rebecca Pritchard smiles while standing with her husband and daughter.

props.synopsis: When financial planner Rebecca Pritchard was starting her family, she used a little-known strategy called contribution splitting to keep her superannuation ticking over.

title.children: The little-known strategy that can help couples address the gender super gap

image.altText: A photo of NT Attorney-General Selena Uibo at the announcement of the Aboriginal Justice Agreement.

props.synopsis: Selena Uibo has been named the new leader of Territory Labor after the party's landslide defeat in the NT election. It makes her the first Indigenous woman to lead a major political party in Australian history.

title.children: New NT Opposition Leader Selena Uibo becomes first Indigenous woman to lead a major Australian party

image.altText: Skyscapers make up a very business end of town skyline

props.synopsis: As Australian mortgage holders wait for relief, the Reserve Bank of New Zealand cuts rates and green shoots emerge in the housing market.

title.children: 'The first cut is the deepest': NZ's central bank has cut rates and economists are singing a different tune

image.altText: A child's hands plays with toys on wooden table

props.synopsis: A new workforce report has outlined the urgent need for more than 20,000 qualified early childhood education professionals across Australia.

title.children: Early childhood education workforce levels 'not sustainable', report finds

image.altText: Two Australian wheelchair rugby players sit on court in their chairs, smiling and holding an Australian flag behind them.

props.synopsis: Ryley Batt has been a great of wheelchair rugby for two decades, and the Australian star has had an almost-magical combination with teammate Chris Bond for four Paralympics. Batt finished with bronze in Paris, and it's time to be thankful for his brilliant Paralympic career, writes Andrew McGarry.

title.children: Wheelchair rugby great Ryley Batt ends Paralympic career with bronze for Australia
